sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer could lead to freeing invalid memory, causing undefined behavior.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Output buffer could be shared with Normal World, leading to potential information leakage.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflow or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Size parameter can be tainted, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Tainted data could be moved to a shared memory region accessible by the Normal World.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Source could be a shared memory region, allowing tainted data to be copied from a potentially unsafe area.
